musicalLanguage.description: A modern romantic ballad with a gentle, flowing quality. The song uses a simple I-V-vi-IV progression in Bb major with a tender melodic line. This beginner arrangement simplifies the arpeggiated accompaniment to block chords while preserving the emotional melody.
musicalLanguage.structure: Verse (8 bars) — Bb-F-Gm-Eb repeated with melodic development
keyMoments: Bars 1-2: Bb to F — the warm, open beginning that sets the romantic tone
Bars 3-4: Gm to Eb — the emotional deepening as minor harmony enters
Bars 7-8: The melody reaches its highest point then settles — a miniature emotional arc
teachingGoals: Playing in Bb major — two flats (Bb and Eb)
Slow, sustained left-hand chords with a singing melody
Legato playing — connecting notes smoothly without gaps
styleTips: Everything should feel warm and connected — no gaps between notes
The slow tempo means every note matters — place each one carefully
Think of the right hand as a cello solo — rich, sustained, singing

measures.teachingNote: Bb major — the melody starts gently on the 5th degree. Warm and inviting.
F major — melody settles downward. Keep the left hand soft and sustained.
G minor — the melody climbs stepwise. Notice the Eb — it gives the minor color.
Eb major — the IV chord. Melody relaxes downward to Eb.
Bb major again — this time the melody reaches up to Bb4. Expanding the range.
F major — melody pushes to C5, the emotional peak of the phrase.
G minor — a descending line that releases the built-up tension.
Eb to Bb — the phrase closes gently on the tonic. A sigh of contentment.
